title: Overheating components
solutions: Clean dust from all fans and heatsinks
Reapply thermal paste on CPU
Check if all case fans are working
Improve case airflow - add intake/exhaust fans
Verify CPU cooler is properly mounted
Check ambient room temperature

title: RAM not detected
solutions: Reseat all RAM modules firmly
Try each RAM stick individually
Check motherboard QVL for RAM compatibility
Clean RAM slot contacts with compressed air
Test RAM in different slots
Update BIOS to latest version

title: Hard drive not recognized
solutions: Check SATA data and power cable connections
Try different SATA ports on motherboard
Test drive in another computer
Check if drive appears in Disk Management
Update storage drivers
Run hard drive health check tools

title: CMOS battery failure
commonSymptoms: BIOS settings reset on every boot
solutions: Replace the CMOS battery (usually CR2032 coin cell)
Clear CMOS using motherboard jumper (if needed)
Reset BIOS settings to default and save
Ensure battery is properly seated
Check motherboard manual for CMOS battery location

title: GPU not detected
commonSymptoms: Fans spin but no video signal
Games crash or fail to launch
solutions: Reseat GPU into PCIe slot firmly
Ensure GPU power connectors are properly plugged in
Try GPU in a different PCIe slot (if available)
Test GPU in another system to verify it's working
Update motherboard BIOS and chipset drivers
Check BIOS settings for GPU initialization

title: USB ports not working
solutions: Restart PC and check if issue persists
Try USB ports on both front and back panel
Update USB drivers in Device Manager
Check for power settings that may disable USB (Device Manager â†’ Power Management)
Test with known-good USB device
Check motherboard headers and internal USB connections
